nl.inl.blacklab.search.results

Class Results<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.results.Results<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - result type, e.g. Hit
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>, SearchResult
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocGroups, DocResults, HitGroups, Hits, TermFrequencyList

    public abstract class Results<T>
extends Object
implements SearchResult, Iterable<T>
    A list of results of some type.

      • group

        public abstract ResultGroups<T> group(ResultProperty<T> criteria,
                                      int maxResultsToStorePerGroup)
        Group these hits by a criterium (or several criteria).
        Parameters:
        criteria - the hit property to group on
        maxResultsToStorePerGroup - maximum number of results to store per group, or -1 for all
        Returns:
        a HitGroups object representing the grouped hits

      • filter

        public abstract Results<T> filter(ResultProperty<T> property,
                                  PropertyValue value)
        Select only the hits where the specified property has the specified value.
        Parameters:
        property - property to select on, e.g. "word left of hit"
        value - value to select on, e.g. 'the'
        Returns:
        filtered hits

      • sort

        public abstract <P extends ResultProperty<T>> Results<T> sort(P sortProp)
        Return a new Results object with these results sorted by the given property. This keeps the existing sort (or lack of one) intact and allows you to cache different sorts of the same resultset. The result objects are reused between the two Results instances, so not too much additional memory is used.
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the property to sort on
        Returns:
        a new Results object with the same results, sorted in the specified way

      • sample

        public abstract Results<T> sample(SampleParameters sampleParameters)
        Take a sample of results.
        Parameters:
        sampleParameters - sample parameters
        Returns:
        the sample

      • window

        public abstract Results<T> window(int first,
                                  int windowSize)
        Get a window into this list of results. Use this if you're displaying part of the resultset, like in a paging interface. It makes sure BlackLab only works with the results you want to display and doesn't do any unnecessary processing on the other hits. The resulting instance will has "window stats" to assist with paging, like figuring out if there hits before or after the window.
        Parameters:
        first - first result in the window (0-based)
        windowSize - desired size of the window (if there's enough results)
        Returns:
        the window

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • ensureResultsRead

        protected abstract void ensureResultsRead(int number)
        Ensure that we have read at least as many results as specified in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        number - the minimum number of results that will have been read when this method returns (unless there are fewer hits than this); if negative, reads all hits

      • ensureAllResultsRead

        protected void ensureAllResultsRead()
        Ensure that we have read all results.

      • resultsSubList

        protected List<T> resultsSubList(int fromIndex,
                                 int toIndex)
        Get part of the list of results. Clients shouldn't use this. Used internally for certain performance-sensitive operations like sorting. The returned list is a view backed by the results list. If toIndex is out of range, no exception is thrown, but a smaller list is returned.
        Returns:
        the list of hits

      • resultsList

        protected List<T> resultsList()
        Get the list of results. Clients shouldn't use this. Used internally for certain performance-sensitive operations like sorting.
        Returns:
        the list of hits

      • doneProcessingAndCounting

        public abstract boolean doneProcessingAndCounting()
        Check if we're done retrieving/counting hits. If you're retrieving hits in a background thread, call this method from another thread to check if all hits have been processed.
        Returns:
        true iff all hits have been retrieved/counted.
